resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
Marwes commented on pull request #6395: ARROW-7813: [Rust] Remove and fix unsafe code
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6395
 
 
   This removes or corrects many instances of unsafe code in the rust crates. This is by no means a complete fix and some of the fixes do not entirely fix the `unsafe` use but in all instances it should put the code in a better place than before.
   
   Based on #6256

Marwes commented on issue #6395: ARROW-7813: [Rust] Remove and fix unsafe code
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6395#issuecomment-585843997
 
 
   Removed the commits that changed the simd implemented operators. The code is definitely doing undefined behaviour though as the padding won't be initialized ( https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6397#issuecomment-584760039 ).
   
   So either the code could do non-simd operations for the last partial block (if any). Or the padding should be initialized before reading it.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6395#issuecomment-585960758
 
 
   > So either the code could do non-simd operations for the last partial block (if any). Or the padding should be initialized before reading it.
   
   I plan to initialize the padded region, [ARROW-7836](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7836) if no-one beats me to it.

bluss commented on issue #6395: ARROW-7813: [Rust] Remove and fix unsafe code
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6395#issuecomment-612654237
 
 
   Nice, I had named 3 things I saw in arrow 0.16.0 code (not a full review)
   
   (1) about Buffer.ptr being null is intended to be fixed here in this PR. The common way to solve this in Rust is to use https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ptr/struct.NonNull.html#method.dangling - an aligned non-null dummy pointer, but I won't review this solution further, Marwes can probably judge it all as well as I can. Using `NonNull<T>` is certainly an idea.
   (3) about making Buffer::from_raw_parts has been merged as a fix in an older PR.
   
   Issue (2) so remains, no check for allocation failure. This produces dangerous mismatches - null pointer and nonzero length - in various places.
   
   This doesn't have to be fixed in this PR, just to note that the issue is not fixed here.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: The rust implementation contains a lot more unsafe than is necessary and in many of these instances it is possible to invoke undefined behaviour from safe code.
fields.summary: [Rust] Fix undefined behaviour and and remove unsafe
